meanings.definition: To cause confusion or uncertainty in
meanings.sent1: The tricky riddle will perplex the children.
meanings.sent2: The complex math problem can perplex even the smartest students.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve the puzzle only served to perplex him further.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden change in behavior perplexed her friends.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious disappearance of the keys continued to perplex everyone.
